data/research/01-von-neumann-architectur.summary: The von Neumann architecture is the fundamental design principle that underlies most modern computers, introducing the revolutionary concept of the stored-program computer.

data/research/02-unix-philosophy.md.summary: The Unix philosophy is a set of minimalist, modular design principles that emphasize simplicity, composability, and doing one thing well.

data/research/03-assembly-language-princ.summary: Assembly language provides a human-readable representation of machine code instructions, serving as the direct interface between programmers and the von Neumann architecture.

data/research/04-claude-code-runtime-con.summary: Documents Claude Code execution environment constraints and limitations including context management, token usage, and session persistence.
